reviews.review_msg: He really makes you work for your grade. I remember in his tutorial he said he was harsh on marking first year papers to help prep us for future classes. Definitely knowledgeable on the subject of law. Gave study guides for tests, which were really straight-forward. Test questions can be puzzling at times.

Russell was a great prof! His lectures were quite boring but, he tried his best to make them engaging as possible! Exams were very fair! Midterm and Final were based off of a study guide. Make sure you read your textbook for tutorial as it is 20% of your grade. Overall, good prof!!

Let's you pick which topic you want to write for your term paper. Different topics have different due dates. He makes a study guide for the class on what to study for the midterm & final. Note: some of the things on the study guide won't be on the midterm/final. He post his lecture slides a few days later after giving the lecture.
Really boring class and skips through notes really fast. attending class was not mandatory but attending the tutorial was. You must read the text.

You can tell Russell really cared about his students and making sure they understood the material! That being said, his lectures did get boring, partly due to the material and partly due to his slides being overly wordy. Midterm and final based off study guide and were extremely fair. Also, participation in tutorials was worth 20%.

Great class as he makes everything much easier to understand. Midterm was extremely fair. Easily accessible outside of class so make sure you go to him if you ever need help. Overall great course with a solid prof who cares about what he's teaching. Plus he has a lot of experience with the law so he has quite a few interesting stories.
